question: Which of the following is also known as the "Great Alfold Plain"?
explanation: Great Hungarian Plain is also known as the "Great Alfold Plain". The Great Hungarian Plain, also known as Alfold or Great Alfold, is a plain occupying the majority of Hungary. It is the largest part of the wider Pannonian Plain. Its territory significantly shrunk due to its eastern and southern boundaries being rewritten by the new political borders of the post WW1 era, after the Treaty of Trianon in 1920.
